agg.description: CORONERS -- Amends existing law to provide that certain records regarding coroners shall be exempt from disclosure and to provide that next-of-kin shall have access to certain reports prepared by a coroner.

status.label: Refer
status.action: Reported Printed; referred to Judiciary & Rules

raw.title: Amends existing law to provide that certain records regarding coroners shall be exempt from disclosure and to provide that next-of-kin shall have access to certain reports prepared by a coroner.

agg.description: LEWD CONDUCT -- Amends and adds to existing law to establish provisions regarding the crime of aggravated lewd conduct with a minor child under sixteen, to establish provisions regarding the crime of aggravated lewd conduct with a minor child twelve or under, and to provide a punishment for the crime of aggravated lewd conduct with a minor child twelve or under.

status.label: Passed
status.action: Reported Signed by Governor on March 26, 2025 Session Law Chapter 177 Effective: 07/01/2025

type.co: Todd Lakey, Mike Moyle, Treg Bernt, Brent Crane, Josh Keyser, Wendy Horman, Doug Okuniewicz, Barbara Ehardt, Joe Alfieri, Joe Palmer, Ted Hill, Dale Hawkins, Jordan Redman, James Holtzclaw, Brandon Mitchell, John Shirts, Mike Pohanka, Chris Bruce

agg.description: HEALTH AND WELFARE -- Amends, repeals, and adds to existing law to remove provisions previously related to the Department of Health and Welfare that are now assigned to other state agencies and to establish provisions regarding the Insight Integrated Data System.

status.label: Report Pass
status.action: U.C. to be returned to Health & Welfare Committee
